intro: Pelargonium serotinum, commonly known as the late-flowering geranium, is a species native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of pink or red flowers. It blooms late in the growing season, usually from late summer to early autumn. Pelargonium serotinum is well-suited for rock gardens and borders due to its compact growth habit and ornamental value.
